# startOfEncoderSampleIndex

**Instance Property**

The index the Metal device object should use to store GPU counters when starting the resource state pass.

## Declaration

```swift
var startOfEncoderSampleIndex: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

Specify [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterDontSample] if you don’t want to sample GPU counters at the start of the resource state pass. Otherwise, specify an index within the sample buffer where you want the GPU to write the sample data.

On devices that don’t support [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterSamplingPoint/atStageBoundary] you need to set the value to [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterDontSample].

## Configuring the sample buffer attachment

- **sampleBuffer**: A specialized memory buffer that the GPU uses to store its counter data during the resource state pass.
- **endOfEncoderSampleIndex**: The index the Metal device object should use to store GPU counters when ending the resource state pass.
